titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Bramlette, Agent, William Hipwell
CWG1139

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
IN THE NAME AND BY THE AUTHORITY OF THE
COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY,
KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL
THOMAS E. BRAMLETTE,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEALTH.
TO ALL WHOM THESE PRESENTS SHALL COME, GREETING:

Know Ye, That reposing especial trust and confidence in the integrity, diligence, and ability of Wm Hipwell, I do hereby appoint him Agent, On the part of this State, to proceed to the State of Illinois for the purpose of demanding and receiving from the proper authorities of said state, Mathew FSkifington, a Fugitive from Justice from the State of Kentucky, charged with Felony; and I do hereby authorize and direct the said Wm Hipwell to demand and receive the said Fugitive, bring him to this State, and deliver him to the custody of the Jailer of the County of Jefferson Ky

figure.ab:
SEAL OF KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL

body.p: In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent, and the Seal of the Commonwealth to be hereunto affixed. Done at Frankfort, the 13th day of October, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and sixty-5, and in the seventy-fourth year of the Commonwealth.

Tho E Bramlette
By the Governor: E. L. VanWinkle, Secretary of State.
By Jas R. Page
Asst Secty
GEORGE D. PRENTICE, STATE PRINTER.
This is to certify that this Day William Hipwell Delivered to me the person of Mathew Skiffington herein mentioned

W. K Thomas Jailor
of Jefferson County Ky
